keyTakeAways: Ian Roberts, originally from Guyana, falsely claimed U.S. citizenship on an I-9 form when hired as superintendent of Des Moines Public Schools in 2023.
Roberts was detained by ICE on September 26, 2025, and fled in a district-issued Jeep Cherokee before being found with a handgun wrapped in a towel.
Federal authorities allege he made a false attestation on an I-9 form and unlawfully possessed firearms while illegally in the U.S.
Three additional weapons—two pistols, a rifle, and a shotgun—were found during a search of his home, bringing the total to four firearms.
An immigration judge previously issued a final removal order, and an appeal to reopen immigration proceedings was rejected.
Des Moines Public Schools filed a lawsuit against the consulting firm that facilitated the superintendent search, alleging improper marketing and influence.
Jackie Norris, school board chair, proposed a review of Roberts’ expenditures and ended her Senate campaign following the AP investigation.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ian Roberts, a former superintendent of Des Moines Public Schools, has been indicted by a federal grand jury for falsely claiming U.S. citizenship on an I-9 form and for unlawfully possessing firearms while an illegal alien. The indictment, returned in October 2025, follows his detention by ICE on September 26, 2025, after he fled in a district-issued vehicle. Authorities found multiple firearms, including a handgun in the vehicle and three others at his home. Roberts, originally from Guyana, had previously been denied immigration status and had an appeal rejected. The Des Moines Public Schools district is now pursuing legal action against a consulting firm that allegedly promoted Roberts as a consultant during the hiring process. Additionally, school board chair Jackie Norris initiated a review of Roberts’ spending and dropped her Senate campaign amid public scrutiny.
title: Iowa Superintendent Detained by ICE Falsely Claimed He Was a US Citizen, Indictment Says
